p: To validate our general transmission heterogeneity detection method, we tested the performance of the inference algorithm on simulated data. As reported the average time between infection and diagnosis/treatment for HIV-1 in Sweden is around 2.5 years [ 11, 25, 26], so we set the rate of diagnosis at γ = 1/2.5 with year being our unit of time. We set R 0 = 2.5 (implying that μ λ = 1) which is in agreement with the previous study on the transmission of HIV in Switzerland [ 22]. We varied the level of transmission heterogeneity (i.e. CV = σ λ/ μ λ) from 0 (no heterogeneity) to 5 (extremely high heterogeneity).
